title: Tameka Empson confirms EastEnders Christmas return for Kim Fox-Hubbard
text:
Kim Fox-Hubbard left EastEnders viewers upset when she departed from Albert Square earlier this year, but Christmas brings with it plenty of reasons to celebrate — one of which is the return of the beloved character, as actress Tameka Empson has confirmed that Kim will be heading back to Walford just in time for the approaching holiday season.

As of yet, the details surrounding Kim’s return are currently unknown — and aside from calling her return storyline a ‘Christmas cracker’ Tameka isn’t sure what exactly brings the character back to Walford, but hopes that the show’s bosses have something ‘big’ in store for her.

She told The Daily Star: ‘Kim has been working in Scotland as a tour guide. If anyone can do that, it’s Kim’.

‘But she’s coming back soon. And I’m hoping it will be a big storyline. With Kim Fox it’s got to be big. We can’t just have her turning up at the cafe.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I don’t know what I’ll be doing. All I know is it will be a Christmas cracker.’

Last we saw Kim, she headed off to Scotland for a new business venture after Denise (Diane Parish) fired her from Fox & Hair for being the cause of the conflict between her and Chantelle (Jessica Plummer).

Kim struggled to accept the fact that Chantelle and Gray (Toby-Alexander Smith) had moved into the house she owned with Vincent (Richard Blackwood) — before he disappeared early last year after getting involved with crook Aidan Maguire (Patrick Bergin).

Discussing her experience thus far on the BBC One soap, Tameka said: ‘Being at EastEnders is like going on a holiday. Even though it’s work, I enjoy it.’

‘I’ve had fans saying they want to see Kim back on the show, which is really nice. It’s really lovely. I do miss playing her. She keeps me on my toes. She keeps me busy.’

Advertisement Advertisement
description: Tameka has revealed what she hopes is in store for Kim upon her return.
